'''Grinnah''' was a [[Orcs#Orcs and Goblins|Goblin]] interrogator in [[Goblin-town]]. Grinnah was invented by [[Warner Bros.]] for [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' film series]], where he was portrayed by [[Stephen Ure]], who also portrayed [[Fimbul]].

== History ==
Grinnah appeared to be a significant member of the Goblin-town hierarchy, as he directly reported to the [[Great Goblin]] when they captured [[Thorin and Company]] at the [[Front Porch]]. He was responsible for discovering [[Orcrist]] on [[Thorin|Thorin Oakenshield]], and showing it to the Great Goblin, who angrily ordered his subordinates to kill Thorin. When [[Gandalf]] arrived to rescue the Dwarves and they took up arms to fight their way out, Grinnah was stabbed to death by [[Kíli]].<ref>''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]''</ref>

== Personality ==
Grinnah was cunning and vicious, but much like the other goblins, he is a coward. Despite his apparent loyality to the Great Goblin, he actually hated him in secret.<ref>{{webcite|website=[http://www.theonering.com The One Ring]|articleurl=http://www.theonering.com/complete-list-of-film-changes/the-hobbit-an-unexpected-journey|articlename=An Unexpected Journey﻿|accessed=1 July 2017}}</ref>
